text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1994, the PlayStation is a 32-bit console and the first produced by Sony. The PSX will be the most commercialized in its time and will be redesigned and renamed PS One late 2000. It has a RISC processor running at 34 MHz, 2 MB of RAM and a 24-channel sound output ADPCM. Its resolutions range from 256 × 224 to 640 × 480 pixels, in 16 million colors, and can calculate 360,000 rough polygons or 180,000 textured and illuminated per second. It presents a catalog of more than 7900 games and flagship franchises like Resident Evil, Metal Gear, Gran Turismo and Final Fantasy.
